dt: {bc}one that serves legal processes upon another
{bc}a computer in a network that is used to provide {a_link|services} (such as access to files or shared peripherals or the routing of email) to other computers in the network

shortdef: one that serves food or drink
the player who serves (as in tennis)
something used in serving food or drink

dt: {bc}a Web {d_link|server|server} that provides advertisements and advertising services to websites

dt.t: In short, {wi}ad servers{/wi} let both advertisers and Web site owners do their jobs, better, faster and cheaper …

shortdef: a Web server that provides advertisements and advertising services to websites

dt: {bc}a lay person (typically a child or adolescent) who assists the celebrant in a liturgical service

shortdef: a lay person (typically a child or adolescent) who assists the celebrant in a liturgical service

dt: {bc}a computer {d_link|server|server} designed to be used as a modular part of a larger assembly

dt.t: To minimize lag, CCP started using hundreds of {wi}blade servers{/wi}—thin computers that sit vertically on special racks, like books on a shelf—and solid-state drives, which are much faster than the traditional spinning hard-disk drives.

shortdef: a computer server designed to be used as a modular part of a larger assembly
